modules.description: Provides string encoding and decoding operations including HTML escaping, base64 URL encoding, percent encoding, and form URL encoding. Works with strings, lists of path segments, and cookie data to support web-related formatting and parsing. Used for generating HTTP headers, processing query parameters, and constructing URLs and cookies.

The module provides functions for constructing and manipulating HTTP messages, including header management, body handling, and stream-based operations, alongside WebSocket integration for real-time communication. It works with structured data such as message fields, binary/text content, and stream-based abstractions to facilitate client-server interactions. Use cases include building asynchronous HTTP clients, processing streamed data, and managing WebSocket connections within a functional programming framework.

Converts HTTP method variants to and from strings, normalizes method representations, and compares methods for equality. Works with a sum type encompassing standard HTTP methods and custom method strings. Used to standardize method handling in HTTP request parsing and validation.

Provides predicates to classify HTTP status codes into informational, successful, redirection, client error, and server error categories. Converts between status values and integers, retrieves reason phrases, and ensures consistent status representation. Handles specific HTTP status variants and integer-based statuses for protocol-compliant interactions.

This module provides low-level stream management operations, including reading, writing, flushing, and handling WebSocket control frames like pings and pongs, alongside error handling and flow control. It works with character buffers, streams backed by strings, pipes, or custom reader/writer interfaces, and utilizes promises for asynchronous operations. Specific use cases include real-time communication protocols, network data processing, and scenarios requiring precise control over data transmission and closure.

Provides routing, request handling, and response generation for web applications using simple function signatures. Operates on HTTP methods, URLs, and request bodies, returning structured responses. Enables building RESTful APIs and dynamic web pages with minimal setup.

Encodes and decodes strings for web use, handling HTML, base64, percent, and form URL encoding, while managing path segments and cookies for URL and header construction. Constructs and manipulates HTTP messages, supporting headers, bodies, streams, and WebSockets for client-server communication. Normalizes and compares HTTP methods, and classifies status codes into categories with integer and string conversions. Manages low-level streams, WebSocket control frames, and asynchronous operations with buffer and promise-based abstractions for real-time data handling.
